alert.note: Alert for Hatteras Island; Ocracoke Island (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Warning issued December 17 at 4:23AM EST until December 18 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM THIS MORNING TO 7 PM EST MONDAY... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM THIS MORNING TO MIDNIGHT EST MONDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Warning, 2 to 4 feet of inundation above ground level expected in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 12 to 20 feet expected in the surf zone. * WHERE...Ocracoke Island and Hatteras Island. * WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Warning, from 8 AM this morning to 7 PM EST Monday. For the High Surf Advisory, from 8 AM this morning to midnight EST Monday night. * IMPACTS...Up to 2 to 4 feet of inundation above ground level is possible in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways resulting in a low threat of property damage. Some roads and low lying property including parking lots, parks, lawns, and homes adjacent to the waterfront will experience shallow flooding. Minor to locally moderate ocean overwash possible which could affect travel on NC HWY 12 on Ocracoke Island and between Frisco and Hatteras Village. Some shoreline erosion will occur. Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Initially flooding is expected on the oceanside today, then likely transitioning to the soundside tonight and Monday as the winds shift with potential for rapid water level rises. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Coast Guard Hatteras NC MLLW Categories - Minor 2.5 ft, Moderate 3.5 ft, Major 4.5 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.3 ft, Moderate 2.3 ft, Major 3.3 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 17/09 AM 0.0 -1.2 -0.6 1 None 18/02 AM -1.2 -2.4 -1.6 1-2 None 18/12 PM 2.5 1.3 1.7 3-4 Minor 19/01 PM 2.7 1.5 1.9 3 Minor 20/12 AM 2.4 1.2 1.8 3 None &&
info.instruction: Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. If travel is required, do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions.
